intro: Mulinum valentini, commonly known as the Valentine's mullein, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves that are heart-shaped at the base. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early summer. Mulinum valentini is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
